item.title: beepify.io source code available
item.description: All the source code from the beepify posts is available at: https://github.com/hamilton-lima/beepify-server-playframework See the related posts: beepify.io, server side - part 1 beepify.io, server side - part 2

item.title: Closing github issues on commit
item.description: There is no better place to keep track of opensource projects issues, than the issues page at github :) like this one: https://github.com/hamilton-lima/vanhackaton-video-editor/issues And as expected there is an automated way to close the issues with comments from your commit messages. You can use several key words for that as github documentation explains here: https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/, can be: close, closes, closed, fix, fixes, fixed, resolve, resolves, resolved. To fix #4 & #6 I used the following commit message:
